tweets.text:
Dereliction of @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland duty allowing a whole community to be plagued by landfill fumes.
Will you give us back our human rights @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock @DefraGovUK ? #stopthestink @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe https://t.co/PdnJfeAUC2

@hodgehuh @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL I know. Not anywhere anything has come back from @MPGeorgeEustice 
Campaign hopefully starting next week to target George & @DefraGovUK Can‚Äôt believe they‚Äôre leaving us in this position?! @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe #stopthestink

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW @LucyABeaumont thank you for fighting our corner. Silverdale used to be such a lovely place to live and can be again if @EnvAgencyNW get their act together and support the community

tweets.text: @LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW @LucyABeaumont this is our version of a #bluepeterbadge... a very exclusive #StopTheStink Cap... It can even get you a discount at 'The Pit Stop Caf√©' in Silverdale! would love to make an extra one for you where can I send it? üíå https://t.co/iyhq00kHaN

tweets.text: @Markmalkin15 @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @HouseofCommons @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency Agree. I‚Äôve just been past Garners at the lights. Literally cannot take a breath. So toxic it unbearable. Wafting across the Borough and beyond.
@LucyABeaumont @annjsmall @EnvAgencyNW It's cruelty of it's highest form being gassed in your own home!
@StinkStopthe @LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids Thank you Lucy you are amazing! #stopthestink
@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Thank you so much for helping us get this out there, we are all totally in despair

@davemh72 @poppers82 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink It all depends on the wind direction. When it‚Äôs not in your home: the wind is carrying it away and into someone else‚Äôs home, be it 1 or 6 miles away. The toxic stench is always there. WE MUST NEVER FORGET THIS. So basically...If I sleep well  some other poor soul is not! Unite...

tweets.text:
Today hundreds of children are breathing in toxic air in Silverdale due to toxic landfill fumes, the environmental agency @EnvAgencyNW is not working quick enough, this is an emergency. Please share and if you can donate https://t.co/kDuVm2eZef
https://t.co/aIHidTSozg

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL Unfortunately he's only bringing it up in an adjournment debate,something done as the last price of business for a day and not voted on,there will be about three people in the chamber and it will achieve nothing. He's met with eustice who has the power to do something..waiting..

@defra @EnvAgency Do you want your kids or grandkids growing up in the shadow of a gas emitting crap hill ? We sure as hell don't , our children are suffering and we're helpless . You've failed us badly now please rectify it . Shut it down , H2S is not just a stench @StinkStopthe https://t.co/p7KKWCJ86X

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

@Malvernmeet @stushurlock @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency We all have a responsibility to reduce plastic waste - absolutely. We also need to rethink urban drainage and increase green spaces to reduce runoff and take pressure off the sewer system. Dumping untreated wastewater into rivers during low flows is not acceptable.

@richbeanjohnson @davemh72 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink I said this earlier. Gas guilt lol when your free if it some poor person is getting it somewhere else

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: Tomorrow @BBCCountryfile reveals the mass housing freeze across England. This includes the protected Wye, where @EnvAgency believes c.60% of the phosphates pollution problem is down to diffuse agriculture. New homes a fraction of nutrient loading yet the sector here is closed. https://t.co/bbI9aq9crS

Our officers take 20 samples from each designated bathing water throughout the season, before the classification is published in November. This year we have a new bathing water, a point on the Wharfe in Ilkley - the first on an English river to be designated.

Today marks the start of the bathing water season. 
There are more than 50 official bathing waters along the Yorkshire and North East coast, the majority of which are classified as Excellent or Good quality. 
More details at Swimfo: https://t.co/2S0hDR7Gfm https://t.co/dUTcQEUnlG
